channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Demand for local produce must complement supply in local food production: Amy Khor
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:58 PM

SINGAPORE - Although an overwhelming majority of people here said they would buy more locally grown food, only around two thirds of them can easily identify home-grown produce.

item.title: 202 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore
item.description:
July 18, 2020 3:33 PM

There are seven community cases and eight imported cases.

item.title: Veteran diplomat Tony Kemal Siddique dies of heart attack, aged 80
item.description:
July 18, 2020 3:11 PM

SINGAPORE - Mr Tony Kemal Siddique, a veteran diplomat who was most recently Special Envoy for Arctic Affairs, died on Friday night (July 17) of a heart attack.

item.title: New Covid-19 test kit by DSO and A*Star cuts testing time by half
item.description:
July 18, 2020 2:02 PM

The improved Covid-19 test kit, which uses fewer raw materials that are limited in supply during the pandemic, is able to deliver results in less than two hours.

item.title: Muslim couples learn about foster parenting, clarify religious aspects in webinar
item.description:
July 18, 2020 1:00 PM

SINGAPORE - More than 50 couples attended a seminar on foster parenting on Saturday (July 18), to learn about fostering in Islam and clarify concerns they might have.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 18
item.description:
July 18, 2020 8:37 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, July 18.

item.title: All decked out in red and white for National Day
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Block 9 Selegie Road is once again decked out in its National Day best.

item.title: Coronavirus: 123 people linked to clusters at Tampines block test negative
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 123 people who live in or visited a Tampines Housing Board block linked to known Covid-19 clusters have undergone polymerase chain reaction tests, with all their results coming back negative.

item.title: 2 teens fined for vaping on train; a third given warning
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Three teenagers who brazenly used an electronic vaporiser onboard an MRT train, and posted the act on social media, have been hauled up by the authorities.

item.title: Singapore must be ready to face second Covid-19 wave: Gan Kim Yong
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is not letting its guard down and should be prepared for a second wave of infections, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said yesterday.

item.title: Singapore researchers discover antibodies that neutralise coronavirus
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The search for antibodies that can neutralise the coronavirus in a Covid-19 patient can be like looking for a needle in a haystack, but researchers in Singapore have prevailed.

item.title: 2 commanding officers face less serious charges
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) officers who had claimed trial over a ragging incident in which a full-time national serviceman died two years ago are now facing less serious charges.

item.title: SMU links up with 8 firms to offer PMEs courses for career change
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Management University (SMU) is linking up with eight companies to co-deliver courses that will help upskill people keen to make a career change.

item.title: Join experts at ST webinar as they discuss Covid-19, six months on
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Some of the topics to be discussed include what scientists have learnt about the virus and what the resurgence in cases overseas means for Singapore.

item.title: Director gets fine, $1m penalty for helping firm understate income tax
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

A company director has been fined $5,000 and ordered to pay a penalty of more than $1 million for helping his company, used-car dealer BW Automobiles, understate its income tax.

item.title: Coronavirus: Leisure travel may not be possible this year, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's travel advisory position is unlikely to change in the near term.

item.title: ST+ news with benefits
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

It's durian season and you can see and smell the King of Fruits everywhere.

item.title: 24 years' jail for man who sexually abused siblings
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

A 47-year-old paedophile who took his lover's two children to a hotel in Geylang for "sleepovers" - making the girl, eight, and boy, nine, perform sexual acts on each other - was jailed for 24 years and given 24 strokes of the cane yesterday.

item.title: Singapore can avoid coronavirus resurgence by learning from other nations: Gan Kim Yong
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

There has been a resurgence in the number of Covid-19 cases in countries such as Japan and Australia because safe management measures have not been adhered to. This includes people joining large gatherings or not wearing masks.

item.title: Mozzies to fight dengue in Yishun, Tampines
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Residents of Housing Board blocks across Yishun and Tampines may notice more mosquitoes in the coming weeks. But these ones are not out for blood.

item.title: Book dispenser for CCK residents while library gets a revamp
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Library users in Choa Chu Kang (CCK) can now browse and borrow books even though the branch there is closed for renovations.

item.title: Too early to say if Covid-19 cases will emerge from Polling Day queues: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The Elections Department (ELD) did its best to keep voters safe on Polling Day and it is too early to say if infections would occur as a result of voters having to wait in line for upwards of an hour in some places, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong yesterday.

item.title: Q1 visitor arrivals, tourism receipts in Singapore down
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's tourism sector reported steep declines in international visitor arrivals and tourism receipts for the first quarter of this year amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Citi raises nearly $177k to help migrant workers
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Citi Singapore employees have raised $176,749 for non-profit group Humanitarian Organisation for Migrant Economics (Home) as part of its month-long campaign called Citi Supports Home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Close watch on symptomatic unlinked cases in community
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Since the lifting of the circuit breaker on June 2, the number of community cases has increased, although they continue to remain low with about an average of 12 per day in the past week, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said during a virtual press conference yesterday.

item.title: DNA tests to identify S'porean swept into sea in Australia
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The Australian authorities have taken DNA samples from family members of a missing Singaporean, after human remains were found near where the student was swept into the ocean.

item.title: Sun-loving cockles of Singapore
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The phrase "warmed the cockles of my heart" has been the subject of much amusement and intrigue since MP Jamus Lim used it to thank Sengkang GRC voters after they elected his Workers' Party team into Parliament in the recent general election.

item.title: Coronavirus: Positive cases among workers can be expected even after dorms cleared
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singapore heads into the final stretch of testing and clearing all migrant workers in dormitories of the coronavirus by the middle of next month, the number of daily infections among this group can be expected to rise, Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Drug courier's 25-year jail sentence increased to life
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

A drug courier's jail sentence was increased to life imprisonment following an appeal.

item.title: I spent four hours in an isolation room
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

With their metallic exterior, the box-like isolation rooms at Singapore General Hospital's newly built Ward@Bowyer resemble futuristic capsules sheltering people from the hustle and bustle of space travel.

item.title: Why dorms with lower Covid-19 prevalence were cleared first
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

There were concerns that the strategy to clear dorms with fewer cases first had put more workers at risk.

item.title: LTA awards 4 contracts worth $682.5m for JRL
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Four contracts worth a total of $682.5 million for the Jurong Region Line (JRL) - including the design and construction of three stations on the MRT line - were awarded by the Land Transport Authority yesterday.

item.title: Scaled-up perovskite solar cells prove their conversion power
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Multicoloured and semi-transparent solar cells made of perovskite have been shown to display the highest power conversion efficiency when they are scaled up.

item.title: Task force's work won't be affected even if Cabinet portfolios change: Gan Kim Yong
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

The work of the multi-ministry task force tackling Covid-19 will not be affected, even if portfolios were to change in the upcoming Cabinet reshuffle, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong stressed yesterday.

item.title: Armed robbery cases in S'pore Strait at 5-year high
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Incidents of armed robbery reported in the Singapore Strait have hit a five-year high.

item.title: Local scientists create 'mini livers' to trial therapies for liver diseases
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Local scientists here have successfully created human liver organoids, or "mini livers", to help them develop and trial therapies for various liver diseases.

item.title: Two babies among three new imported coronavirus patients
item.description:
July 18, 2020 5:00 AM

Two of the three new imported Covid-19 cases announced yesterday were baby girls, both aged one, who returned from India.

item.title: Building lasting relationships in community care
Two baby girls among new imported coronavirus cases
item.description:
July 18, 2020 12:33 AM

One is a dependant's pass holder and the other is a long-term pass holder.
